docs.lead_paragraph: 8 P.M. (Lifetime) THE PREGNANCY PROJECT (2012) In this film based on real events, Alex Vega, above, plays Gaby Rodriguez, an 18-year-old high school student from Washington State who pretended to be pregnant to explore the prejudices and presumptions surrounding teenage pregnancy. Judy Reyes plays Gaby's mother, who went along with the experiment. A discussion guide, links to resources and an excerpt from Ms. Rodriguez's book can be found online at mylifetime.com. 10:30 A.M. (13) RELIGION & ETHICS NEWSWEEKLY Kim Lawton reports from Florida on the divisions among evangelical Christians over which Republican presidential candidate to support. Lucky Severson looks at the Yoido Full Gospel Church, a Pentecostal church in Seoul, South Korea, that has thousands of worshippers, grants prominent positions to women and tells members that if they give to God, they will be rewarded with prosperity.

headline.main: Soap Operas With a Social Message

docs.abstract: In countries around the world, T.V. serials are being used to deliver important social messages to millions of viewers.
docs.snippet: In countries around the world, T.V. serials are being used to deliver important social messages to millions of viewers.

docs.lead_paragraph: Every Sunday evening, seven million Kenyans sit in front of their television sets to watch "Makutano Junction," a soap opera set in a fictional village. In one episode, audiences watch as a woman, Mama Mboga, holds her crying infant. "I need some money to take Joni to hospital," she tells her husband, Erasmus, after he wakes up and takes a swig from a bottle. "I think he has malaria." Erasmus insists that his son is healthy, that she is overreacting and that he has no money to give her.

docs.lead_paragraph: President Obama’s call for every state to require students to stay in school until they turn 18 is Washington’s first direct involvement in an issue that many states have found tough to address.

headline.seo: Obama Wades Into Issue of Raising Dropout Age
headline.main: Obama Wades Into Issue of Raising Dropout Age
headline.print_headline: Obama Wades Into Issue Of Raising Dropout Age

docs.abstract: President Obama’s State of the Union call for every state to require students to stay in school until they turn 18 is Washington’s first direct involvement in an issue that many governors and state legislators have found tough to address.
docs.snippet: President Obama’s call for every state to require students to stay in school until they turn 18 is Washington’s first direct involvement in an issue that many states have found tough to address.

docs.lead_paragraph: British researchers found that a common American practice for in vitro fertilization was associated with more complications than the transfer of just two embryos.

headline.seo: Use of 3 or More In Vitro Embryos Is Too Risky, Study Concludes
headline.main: Regimens: Use of 3 or More Embryos Is Called Too Risky
headline.print_headline: Regimens: Use of 3 or More Embryos Is Called Too Risky

docs.abstract: British study published in journal The Lancet finds that the transfer of more than two embryos during in vitro fertilization does not increase the number of live births, but it does increase the risk of complications; about 40 percent of in vitro fertilizations in the United States currently involve the transfer of three or more embryos.
docs.snippet: British researchers found that a common American practice for in vitro fertilization was associated with more complications than the transfer of just two embryos.

docs.lead_paragraph: What disgusts humans is proving irresistible to researchers exploring the evolutionary value of revulsion.

headline.seo: Disgust’s Evolutionary Role Is Irresistible to Researchers

docs.abstract: Human emotion of disgust, an emotion long neglected by psychologists, has become the subject of a flurry of new books and papers by scientists; evolutionary psychologists are now looking at disgust as an important and complicated adaptation to avoid disease-causing microbes and parasites that involves not only taste and smell but also sight and touch.
docs.snippet: What disgusts humans is proving irresistible to researchers exploring the evolutionary value of revulsion.
